definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon

sentences.english: She was five years ago, and Lee Hyun-Prince Edward meet by chance, love at first sight.
sentences.chinese: 她五年前和李贤太子萍水相逢，一见钟情。

sentences.english: "How can? We barely know each other. " she said.
sentences.chinese: “可是我们，只是萍水相逢吧”她说。

sentences.english: Jack and jill, merry meet, merry part, became good friends.
sentences.chinese: 杰克和吉尔萍水相逢成为好朋友。

sentences.english: I guess I don't have to call you, now that I ran into you!
sentences.chinese: 既然我们萍水相逢了，我想就没必要击电话给你了。

sentences.english: Maybe we meet by chance or passing traveller of human society .
sentences.chinese: 也许萍水相逢，或许红尘过客。

sentences.english: A coincidental meeting can be beauty.
sentences.chinese: 有一种萍水相逢叫美丽。

sentences.english: I'm your princess for a night.
sentences.chinese: 我是你的萍水相逢的公主。

sentences.english: There improbable friends pledged to be blood brothers.
sentences.chinese: 在那里，萍水相逢的朋友结成了生死与共的兄弟。

sentences.english: Ever think of the everlasting, nothing is truly meet by chance.
sentences.chinese: 曾经认为的天长地久，实在不外是萍水相逢。

sentences.english: I don't think I will ever see her again. We are but ships that pass in the night .
sentences.chinese: 我想我不会再见到她，因为我们只是萍水相逢而已。

definition: to have never met sb before (idiom); entirely unacquainted/a complete stranger/not to know sb from Adam
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
to know oneself/to be intimate or close/intimate friend
friendship between gentlemen, insipid as water (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])
to meet again after a long period of separation
to get to know each other/acquaintance
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
